list_definition.definition: a type of skin disease in which there is an itchy rash

list_ex_of_english: Defects in formation of inflammatory mediators may be important in eczema.
For scabies, there is sometimes confusion with eczema but nocturnal pruritus is a particularly suggestive clinical feature helping to distinguish it.
It is believed by some that patients presenting with generalized eczema in later life should be investigated for underlying malignancy.
Further primary atopic eczema research that addresses these questions is needed.
In cases in which bacterial superinfection impairs eczema herpeticum, systemic antibiotic treatment should also be used.
It was an early ingredient in ointments against skin parasites and eczema.
Paste bandages may aid the healing of associated varicose eczema.
Treatment is avoidance of the allergen and topical steroids to settle the eczema.
